DOC.brief_title: Study Pharmacokinetics ASP1941 Effect Glucose Concentrations Male Female Young Elderly Healthy Adults
DOC.criteria: Male female , healthy nonelderly ( age 1845 year , inclusive ) healthy elderly ( age 65 ) If female , subject pregnant nursing , use medically acceptable contraceptive method prevent pregnancy screen study discharge Body weigh 60 100kg body Mass Index 20 30kg/m2 , inclusive Negative urine screen drug abuse , include alcohol cotinine History type 1 type 2 diabetes Fasting plasma glucose level high 6.4mmol/L hemoglobin A1c level high 6.2 % Presence renal glucosuria and/or proteinuria Clinically significant history asthma , eczema , allergic condition . Clinically significant history upper gastrointestinal symptom within 4 week prior admission clinical unit . History clinically significant neurological , gastrointestinal , renal , hepatic , pulmonary , metabolic , cardiovascular , psychiatric , endocrine , hematological disorder disease , medical condition would preclude participation study . History multiple drug allergy know allergy suspect hypersensitivity study drug chemically related derivative study drug component formulation Has hepatitis positive result serology test hepatitis A antibody Immunoglobulin M , hepatitis B surface antigen hepatitis C virus screen Known positive human immunodeficiency virus antibody . Donated one unit ( 450 mL ) blood plasma within 60 day prior first dose study medication . Has history consume average 2 ounce alcoholcontaining product per day history alcoholism drug/chemical abuse within last 3 year . Use tobacco nicotinecontaining product within 120 day prior first dose study medication . Taken prescribe systemic topical medication within 21 day prior first dose study medication exception contraceptives prevent pregnancy . Taken systemic topical overthe counter medication , complementary alternative medication , e.g. , vitamin , herbal , nutritional supplement , exception acetaminophen , within 10 day prior first dose study medication . Taken investigational drug within 30 day first dose study medication
